metadata.title: CVE-2023-38621 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Multiple integer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the VZT facgeometryparsing functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .vzt file canlead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a maliciousfile to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns theinteger overflow when allocating the `flags` array.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
